body:
> Now with #859 merged, warnings cause build to fail. Fixing them as they cause build fail now

@percyashu FYI that's done in #893

> @nemux anything we can do to help you wrap this up?
> 
> PS: If you think adding a test for this is too much to ask for this PR, I also don't really mind at all if we merge this without a test (once you made it pass the build, of course; and provided feedback the other more minor points raised above), and then create another JIRA and you perhaps contribute the test in a later PR. If Email sending is currently broken (it is?), then I guess fixing it even without a test yet is still better than having it broken! 😄

Hello @vorburger ! i'm going to work on this, just let me have a little time to continue with that! In order to add the testt and fix compilation issues!

And I think that if the test is necessary, let's add it to continue improvement the quality of the Fineract project!
I have little knowledge about this but I trust the changes are OK.
This is red. I'll close this and open a PR with this fully resolved.
Checkstyle failed, you can run it locally and fix it.

The build passed locally, I see my IDE messed some files up.
Fixing them in the next commit.
@vorburger, @ptuomola @awasum, is this OK for you?

Dear first time contributor,

Welcome to Apache Fineract!!

Have you read https://github.com/apache/fineract/#pull-requests?

Already subscribed to our mailing list, by sending an (empty) email to dev-subscribe@fineract.apache.org?

Created your JIRA account on https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/FINERACT/?

Played with our server at https://www.fineract.dev?

We're very excited to have you onboard contributing.

> @vorburger, @ptuomola @awasum, is this OK for you?

Looks like it builds! But I don't know if that Batch ResolutionHelper class has any test coverage... perhaps you could have a quick look using https://github.com/apache/fineract#code-coverage-reports if it those? If the lines you're changing here is covered by tests, then I'm OK to merge this. If not, perhaps someone should review that `JsonModel` => `JsonPath` + `ReadContext` business a little more closely... anyone reading this interested in having a closer look and doing a real code review?

PS: It would be neat if somehow automatically code coverage would show in PRs... anyone got an idea?
@vorburger If the build passes, we can see the "messed files".

Few points:
1. Some of the (30-40 out of 900) of the system.out were commented and not converted to log.info, since the build failed(with a weird reason), one of it was deleted 
2.  There are few files 4-5, to which my ide decided to beautify without asking me :p, if it is not big issue we can merge this, or maybe I can copy the old version of that file and make those changes again?
@ptuomola @awasum @xurror review this one - OK to merge?

@ptuomola I'm totally with you on the principle that in theory we should never touch existing Flyway SQL migration scripts, only write new ones (that's kind of the point of Flyway). I suspect that you are correct that this will not give us automagic migration, but at least the script is cleaner for new installs? In this particular instance, it's probably "not worth it" to do the same via migration scripts - what do you think? Personally I don't really have a problem with this getting merged.

@thesmallstar this mostly LGTM now. Feedback:

0. can you amend the commit message, and PR title/description, with the related JIRA, please?

1. not sure what that's about, probably doesn't matter; let's ignore and move forward?

2. can you chagne your IDE to avoid that in the future? But let's not redo this, but keep going. (The beautificating your IDE did behind your back appears to be related to max. line length? That is actually one of the Checkstyle modules... note `LineLength` - but let's get to that later, only; it has less priority (value) than e.g. the logging and exception handling related checks. But when we do get to that, we can discuss just exactly how long we want lines to be maximum. I think your IDE has it set to be too short; there's no need to break everything at 80 - the (right now still commented out) config currently has it at 120, but personally I'd probably even go for something bigger, like 160 or perhaps 140. We all have big screens nowadays! :smile:
Updated the commit message, will keep all of your suggestion(commit-msg,ide) in mind :D
@ptuomola makes sense?
I've exceptionally self-merged this, because I needed it to unblock and continue with FINERACT-970.
Makes perfect sense to me!
Looks great to me anyway!

@vorburger Fully agreed that if none of the changes have any impact on functionality, then it doesn't matter and doing this via a migration script is "not worth it". 

Unfortunately I don't have enough knowledge about MySQL's innards to assess whether that's the case for these changes, so happy to defer to the judgement of others...
I'm going to self-merge this in order to be able to test FINERACT-970. We could always revert it if NOK.

Thanks. Looks good

One thing which may or may not be important is, why don't you use a stable
version of Ubuntu say 18.04 or 20.04 LTS than the Ubuntu-latest image?

Ignore if the above comment is stupid. I don't know enough about GitHub
actions, just curious.

On Sat, May 16, 2020, 22:08 Michael Vorburger ⛑️ <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Merged #899 <https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/899> into develop.
>
> —

self merged like #900 and #899 previously, in order to be able to test this (easier like this than on branch)

> One thing which may or may not be important is, why don't you use a stable version of Ubuntu say 18.04 or 20.04 LTS than the Ubuntu-latest image?

To be honest I just copy/pasted that line... I don't think it matters much - this is just for a very short lived container, to run an action. BTW GitHub Actions seems pretty cool!
@xurror @ptuomola @awasum check this out.. do you have any better ideas? Merge?
@thesmallstar @xurror review this?
@awasum @ptuomola @xurror wanna review this one from 2 weeks ago - OK to merge?

I've just rebased this and resolved conflicts. @awasum given that we haven't heard back from @Anh3h within 1 week, and that @ptuomola expresses support for _"great if we can get rid of Mockrunner with its awful dependency tree"_ and my explanations about the value of this test, would you have any strong objections to merging this? It's a simplification of our dependencies which we will only be grateful for in the future, at the loss of a IMHO useless test.
@awasum @ptuomola would you review and LGTM this for merge if I resolved the conflicts here?
@awasum @xurror any thoughts about this one? Anyone in particular you know for testing this?
see also #863 and #832
Looks good to me!

Couldn't help but notice references to 2 different issues in your commits. Changes are very little though. I don't know if they are co-dependent but would have been much better to raise 2 different PRs for each of them. But as I said, very little changes so, I don't mind if you merge it like this

Please, merge it now. I just wanted someone familiar with the notification
feature to look at it. But we can't keep waiting for that forever. So merge
this ASAP. Thanks and sorry for holding this  that's precious time but it
was for a good reason.

wrote:

@awasum Is this OK for you too?

@ptuomola no objections to this? See linked JIRA. If @awasum or @xurror merge this ASAP, then I'll send an email to the dev list to announce the auto-updating of fineract.dev, which finally fully works end2end, since yesterday! I'd love this to be merged before I announce, because this change helps to "see" what's actually running on Fineract.dev.

Looks good - except the previous comment that copying .git slows things down, and that is why it was excluded. Is that no longer the case - ie do we not end up with the same issue now that we are again including .git? It's basically copying the entire repository history, right?

Can we get the CI system to copy just the latest revision of the history? Will that help?
Like:
`git clone -–depth [depth] [remote-url]`
Maybe we do this in a follow up PR? Or even rethink the issue of adding latest git revision in /actuator/info... IS there a better way?
I will merge this and someone can cycle back to this in the near future.

https://demo.fineract.dev/fineract-provider/actuator/info - yay!! (This was fully automated.)

@ptuomola @awasum see my comments in FINERACT-983 and FINERACT-911 re. your points.
This pull request seems to be stale.  Are you still planning to work on it?  We will automatically close it in 30 days.
https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/907
@nnatarajan We have a classpath duplicate error.
Maybe try to exclude groovy-all in dependencies.gradle.
The general direction LGTM here... please tag me again when it builds green for a full review.

@nnatarajan if stuck/unclear on this, it's totally OK (for me) if you first look at another issue, and come back to this later after someone else had a chance to look at this problem more closely? As @xurror said it probably needs some exclusion, but it's not always very obvious which.. BTW someone could write up a short paragraph for the README with some guidance about how to do these upgrades - anyone interested?
@vorburger I meant with "-Werror" errorprone compiler warnings are now errors.

@percyashu  or @nnatarajan , Will u be interested to pick this up and address the comments, build ontop of this and send a new PR. See the issue: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-609
 Indicate here if you will be working on it and assign the issue to yourself.

@vorburger there are many instances where printStacktrace is used in a non-test file, for that case should I comment or remove the line only? Or Am I expected to follow the same approach(which turns out to be weird due to inheritance).

@thesmallstar no in non-test it depends.. definitely never printStackTrace() but either catch(SomeException e) { LOG.error("explanation", e) -OR- (re, "chain") throw NewEception("Details", e) - but typically never BOTH log and re-throw but only either-or. HTH?
Cool!!  I'll review this ASAP (coming days) - just want to double check all removed casts.
@xurror have you had a chance to check if that Batch ResolutionHelper class has any test coverage?

Yes. One test.

wrote:

@vorburger  This build should pass, in the file MultiException the printStacktrace method was overridden and a custom print-stream/writer was used for specific logging purpose, I was unsure how to tackle that? For now, I have deleted the lines(definitely needs a better approach), what do you think?

@xurror 

I ran the integration test, but this specific error did not come up. How do I duplicate this specific error on my end: **classpath duplicate error**?

It's a unit test (that I wrote..), not an integration test. You can even
easily run that test in your IDE, it should give you the same result?

>

Sounds good. Please let me know the best way to access the test.

The build has passed on Travis I am not sure why is this still yellow? 
https://travis-ci.org/github/apache/fineract/builds/688892634
@vorburger whoops, I missed that from the last message, Updating it.

@ptuomola do you want to LGTM this so that I can (self) merge this? :smiley: 

@nnatarajan this should unblock your #907.
@xurror perhaps you'd also like to review and merge this if build passes? Tx!

> Maybe try to exclude groovy-all in dependencies.gradle.

@xurror in this particular case, the problem was different - #911 should hopefully fix it.

@nnatarajan I'm not sure exactly how your "git foo" skills are, but it occurred to me that something "fun" but very very useful which you could try to learn, if you'd like, if you don't know this already, is how to "fetch" this change and "cherry-pick" to a local Git branch "on top of" your #907, to convince yourself that it fixes that problem, after you have first managed to get `ClasspathHellDuplicatesCheckRuleTest` to fail. The interesting part is learning the process for how to do this WITHOUT having to wait for this PR to be merged...

There are actually 2 totally separate problems here - the  #911 business (solved), but also some weird incompatibility between this upgrade and the Spotbugs Gradle problem... :sob: @nnatarajan this isn't exactly the greatest "starter issue"... :smiling_imp:  Would anyone else reading this want to help with figuring out the Spotbugs Gradle problem here? /Cc @thesmallstar if you are interested by this sort of thing...

> Yes. One test.

which one? I just ran https://github.com/apache/fineract#code-coverage-reports, and found that `ResolutionHelper` basically has 0% unit test coverage (except for its constructor). We therefore can't really know if these change break that class, or everything still works as before. There may be 2 separate issues - FINERACT-985 ITs are not covered by Jacoco + `ResolutionHelper` may or may not be covered by any IT (I don't know).

I'll just merge his anyway, but it's theoretically possible that it break some batch related feature.
I've just posted "OAuth testing?" to the Dev List re. above, and will merge this in 1 week from today.

@ptuomola you raise (as always, thanks!) some excellent points above....

How about #913 instead of this?
@ptuomola are you in favour of this?
I wonder if that Spotbugs Gradle problem may just disappear with #913 ... worth a rebase, after that's in.
LGTM

Yes - probably the simplest solution. Just out of interest: which version do we end up with this? Hopefully the newest of the dependencies, rather than just what has been cached or is referenced first?
In line with your comments in the JIRA ticket, do we also want to say something about when to use different log levels - i.e. what is the meaning of ERROR/WARN vs INFO/DEBUG/TRACE?

Given that Travis and Spotbugs have not complaint, the problem is fixed. Also given the spotbugs problem required using a Guava version above 23, this has now, surely(i have not looked closely) been fixed given the Guava version on the classpath via transitive dep will be higher than 23. We can merge this ASAP. We can always reverse in case of problems. Thanks @vorburger and @ptuomola for this.

@nnatarajan take note. A good resource coming in the README for you and others. You can just click on the commit and read this for yourself before it is merged see the 'File Changed' tab above:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15528032/82427997-be286b00-9a81-11ea-90ca-e8455f44dd7a.png)
 and https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/910/files

The best way to learn is to shadow experienced Devs and watch their every code commits, comments, PRs etc and ask questions when in doubt. Just like others have done over the years. I hope this helps.

The README is a now becoming a valuable resource. Thanks to @vorburger for leading these efforts together with @ptuomola .
#913 is now merged. Should we therefore close this and not upgrade Guava?
Did we finally merge this? Or we merged and reverted?

> Did we finally merge this? Or we merged and reverted?

Yes it is, merged it myself. Made funny merge commit so I was trying to troubleshoot a work around on remote fork. Didn't notice it was appearing here.
I'll just say my 1st merge didn't go quite well. But it's merged
#913 and #911 have now been merged.
Also see PR https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/910 which has just been merged for some help.
/rebase

> /rebase

Ohhh..this actually works now? Where was it fixed? What was the problem? Just curious.

@nnatarajan ...This now looks more friendly and may be easier to fix? See Travis Log: https://travis-ci.org/github/apache/fineract/builds/689183927
Something about redundant Casting to "Class"
Seems there is a conflict here. @percyashu . Want to address that? Thanks.
LGTM. @ptuomola comment can be addressed in a follow up PR. @ptuomola Want to handle that?
That new problem is just due to the meanwhile merged #908 and should, hopefully, be trivial to resolve... almost there with this one!!
@kiran-vsm . Do you want to address the feedback given to your by fixing the issue and making Travis show green? Do you have a specific problem blocking you ? This will be a valuable contribution?

Build shows that Travis passed: https://travis-ci.org/github/apache/fineract/builds/688892634

But this is still showing pending on the UI? Open and Close? or Rebase?
Also seems there are some issues to be resolved as noted by @vorburger .
See https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/627 do we need to remove the hard coded Timezone we are setting in Travis now with this PR? @vorburger ..Maybe?
See new PR: https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/914 which may be related to this...

Instead of "Runtime exception occurred in...", I would probably just use"problem occurred in..." because the , e) you're adding at the end automatically logs the details, incl. whether or not it was a RuntimeException or what not, so you don't need to repeat that the message. Does that help?
Thank for the quick response :D, on it :)
@vorburger @awasum LGTY?
LGTM, we can extend as we add more checkstyles related to logging :D.
